Key Match Events: Roston Chase played an ice-cool 42 off 27 deliveries to cap off his stunning first innings catch and rescue West Indies' topsy-turvy run-chase.
Andre Russell and Alzarri Joseph were the most successful bowlers for West Indies with a couple of wickets each while except for Roston Chase, every other bowler got at least one wicket.
Papua New Guinea's Sese Bau notched up a valiant fifty for the minnows.
Roston Chase held one end, losing partners at the other, but didn't throw his wicket away and finally found support from Andre Russell.
Post-Match Reflections: Rovman Powell, the victorious skipper of West Indies, appreciates PNG for the way they played and feels it was important to start well. He mentions that they gave away 10-15 runs too many and wants to improve on that aspect.

Assad Vala, the captain of Papua New Guinea, says that it was a competitive score but they missed a trick towards the end and were 10-15 runs short. He adds that they will now want to keep the same level of energy in the next game against Uganda.
Roston Chase, the PLAYER OF THE MATCH, shares that he is very pleased to start the tournament with a win and that no team can be taken lightly in this tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Co-hosts West Indies get off to a winning start.
Papua New Guinea's ground fielding was a bit sloppy, and they gave away a few boundaries that proved to be really costly for them in the end.
